name: Área de Autocaravanas Úbeda
title: (23400) Área de Autocaravanas Úbeda
description: Parking day and night. Very well maintained park with official permission to stay for maximum 48 hours with the usual restrictions on camping behavior. The rules clearly say no chairs or tables out. No cooking outside van. So please don’t!!  next door is an outdoor swimming pool. Great facilities. Lovely planting all around. 10 minute slow walk to the historic quarter. An UNESCO world heritage site teamed with Bezea 10 km away. There is a cycle path between the two. Great food and free tapas are common!

We have met a van that has slept here for a few days and they have told us that the police do not say anything.

title: (23330) Villanueva del Arzobispo - 213 Calle Ramón y Cajal
title_short: (23330) Villanueva del Arzobispo - 213 Calle Ramón y Cajal
description:
*** Closed from 7 to 9 September 2023***

Wonderful parking for motorhomes, caravans and campervans in the heart of the Sierra De Cazorla, Segura and Las Villas. Fully adapted to the needs of our customers. Its ideal location for the entrance to the Las Villas Natural Park (300 meters) and exit to the A-32 motorway (50 meters). We started our journey this September with the desire to improve and listen to the wishes of our customers. Access to the car park is easy, but for any questions or concerns - call on tel. A magical place to rest, to be able to explore our mountains and visit the Sanctuary of the Virgen de la Fuensanta. Near the parking lot you can find a bakery, supermarkets and restaurants.

We stayed one night without a problem

title: (23711) Baños de la Encina -
description: (PRÓXIMA APERTURA) Área para autocaravanas, caravanas y camper. Contamos con zona de vaciado y llenado, aseos, puntos de luz, lavadero y lavandería.

title: (23213) Santa Elena - Autovía del Sur
description: Gas station with area Truck stop Ideal for a stop en route It has showers inside the gas station (price 2.50) they have been open for a month so they are brand new Everything super clean The restaurant is more than decent There is free wifi at the gas station.

title: (23711) Baños de la Encina - J-5042
description: Los Charcones Recreational Area

title: (23213) Santa Elena - 4 Plaza Constitucion
description: At the time, I slept in the school area, but today, walking in the city, I saw an Italian stationed in the town square, and after consulting the local police, I I am here. Glory, as in the old days. There is wifi from the town hall.

title: (23213) Santa Elena - J-6120
description: Parking located next to a school, very quiet and indicated. Perfect to make a stop along the way and rest

title: (23213) Santa Elena - 21 Calle Cádiz
description: Esplanade next to the bullring, flat, with lampposts and wastebaskets

title: (23470) La Iruela - 28 Avenida del Guadalquivir
description: Beautiful place to spend the day and admire the course of the river, it is the starting point of some hiking trails, the place is very quiet and you can see animals that come down to drink, there is a park nearby with tables of picnic and the village is next door wonderful place please keep it clean. Overnight stay is prohibited in the entire town.

title: (23478) Arroyo Frío -
description: After about 1km on sometimes stony and steep dirt road (4x4 or high van necessary) arrived in a clearing in the middle of wild animals (we saw fallow deer, wild boar, a doe and a deer which bellowed for a good part of the night)

title: (23470) Cazorla - JF-7092
description: Camping prohibited as in the entire reservation. Ideal to start hiking trails.

title: (23479) Cazorla - A-319
description: Parking on both sides of the Guadalquivir river. Central del Utrero. Near the town of Cold Arrollo. At the foot of the road

title: (23478) Arroyo Frío -
description: Paid motorhome parking with gray and black emptying service and water filling, animals accepted, free Wi-Fi, etc. 20€/24h

name: Puente de las Herrerias
title: (23470) Puente de las Herrerias
description: Camping Puente de las Herrerías, a spectacular site surrounded by nature and very quiet ..., many activities are held for the whole family throughout the day. Quality excellent price.

name: Camping Despeñaperros
title: (23213) Camping Despeñaperros
description: CAMPING DESPEÑAPERROS. Big camping. Good start for Despeñaperros national park and Cimbarra waterfalls.

title: (23213) Santa Elena - 91 Avenida de Andalucía
description:
Hotel Restaurante Mesón Despeñaperros. offers free private parking day and night.

Possibility of accommodation in the hotel, restaurant and shop of gastronomic products.
Information and reservation: number available to PRO subscribers.

title: (23213) Santa Elena - JA-7100
description: La Aliseda leisure area. On the website of the city of Santa Elena (Jaén) there is a bivouac authorization request form- camping is not allowed. (08/02/2020). Without service There is only one source for water.

title: (23479) Cazorla - JF-7091
description: Directly on the left side of the bridge over the Guadalquivir springing here in the near vicinity, a 1.5 km long circular path leads past a waterfall directly through a gorge. Take binoculars to the bird of prey observation. Half of the way is quite wide, the beginning of the bridge is struck in the rock with stairs.

title: (23711) Baños de la Encina - 3 Calle Donantes de Sangre
title_short: (23711) Baños de la Encina - 3 Calle Donantes de Sangre
description: Small pitch on ground, slightly sloping, next to a park with swings. If there are no other cars parked, two motorhomes enter. Good views of the city and the wall. Without any service (water, electricity ..), only parking.

title: (23213) Santa Elena - N-IVa
description: Halt on the old Despeñaperros road. With a shade to rest or spend the night. No more. The terrain may be somewhat sloping, but it is quiet

title: (23489) Quesada - 21 Tiscar
description: Perfect place to sleep near the Cueva del Agua. It is paved and quite level and has a source with super clean water from the river. The only bad thing is that there are quite a few mosquitoes.

title: (23213) Santa Elena -
description: Navas de Tolosa Battle Museum. Incredible views.

title: (23213) Santa Elena - N-IVa
description: It is a very quiet place to spend the night. It is close to the highway and you can hear cars far in the distance, but it doesn't bother you, you sleep great. In addition, there is good shade to shelter from the sun so it is cool. There is a concrete table with picnic seats.

title: (23489) Tíscar - 7 Tiscar
description: Parking for visitors of Sanctuarium of Tiscar. No services, no shade. It is wrtten there that it is private parking of Tiscar Village not sure if it is ok to spend the night.

title: (23489) Tíscar - 7 Tiscar
description: Parking in the town leveled with land, in the morning the sun does not hit anything for a calmer sunrise

title: (23711) Baños de la Encina -
description: Small forest parking lot with a nice view of the castle and the forest. spent a very quiet night here. Not suitable for very large mobile homes. We have a T4. No services. Some rubbish all around so please take your rubbish with you. Thanks

title: (23489) Tíscar - 7 Tiscar
description: Nice parking place above Cueva del Agua (nice to visit). Below big official parking place, there are unpaved paths under the trees.

title: (23489) Quesada - Calle Cueva del Agua
description: Flat, unpaved esplanade, less than a km from Belerda.

title: (23710) Bailén - Unnamed Road
description: Recreational area parking. Equipped with picnic areas and a water source (I don't know if it's drinkable)

title: (23339) Villanueva del Arzobispo - 1 Calle Cuatro Caminos
title_short: (23339) Villanueva del Arzobispo - 1 Calle Cuatro Caminos
description: Good shady spot for an overnight stop, there is a source of drinking water

title: (23170) La Guardia de Jaén - Paseo de Andalucía
title_short: (23170) La Guardia de Jaén - Paseo de Andalucía
description: Free parking, level, with free services and nice views.

title: (23479) Casa El Valle - Cam. de la Huelga
title_short: (23479) Casa El Valle - Cam. de la Huelga
description:
Linarejos recreational area. It has picnic tables, bathrooms (when we were there they were closed) and what appears to be a beach bar (also closed). Quiet area, surrounded by nature and with little telephone signal (3G).
Overnight stays are not allowed, there are signs prohibiting overnight stays and camping.

title: (23213) Santa Elena - Camino del Barranco del Lobo
title_short: (23213) Santa Elena - Camino del Barranco del Lobo
description: Parking of the visitor center of the Despeñaperros natural park. Very quiet area, surrounded by nature. Trash container, toilet inside the visitor center, no more services. Start of hiking trails.

title: (23711) Baños de la Encina - Unnamed Road
title_short: (23711) Baños de la Encina - Unnamed Road
description: 5 minutes from the small village Baños de la encina, flat place overlooking the lake with incredible views.

title: (23711) Baños de la Encina -
description: Great, largely shady place on the edge of the forest right on the reservoir. Depending on the water level, it is a few meters down to the shore, when the water level is full you are almost right on the water. In the morning completely shaded by the trees, during the day there are also sunny spots to sit or lie down. Fantastic nature that is rarely found in the area. The access is recommended via the upper of the two paths and is very bumpy with larger rocks, but also possible without a 4x4.

title: (23478) - 112 Diseminado Extrarradio
description: Parking without overnight problems. Not particularly beautiful and close to the road, but with other virtues: a restaurant next door (where game meat is eaten quite well and a menu of 13 euros more than acceptable), there are usually no people (even on weekends). weekdays or bridges, when everything is usually full until it is almost impossible to find parking in towns or recreational areas) with a garbage can and good 4g coverage; In addition, to spend the night is great, because from 23 to 8 it is very quiet. Option to consider in high season.

title: (23215) Aldeaquemada - J-6110
description: Very quiet corner. departure of hike / walk waterfall of cimbarra. preferable van. dirt road on 2 km.

title: (23215) Aldeaquemada - J-6110
description: Small clearing at the top, a couple of kilometers from the Cimbarra waterfall.

title: (23210) Zocueca - A-4
description:
Rest area on the way, behind a gas station and an abandoned restaurant. Close to the road but not too noisy and next to a river. Recommended for one night and follow the route.
The gas station is very cheap, it has gas, you can take free water and rubbish.
There are no trucks, so it is quieter than other areas near the highway.

title: (23210) Zocueca -
description: Service station, it has restrooms for public use in good condition. They let us fill the water tank and although they don't have a place to discharge water, they told us that we could discharge gray water on a piece of land that they have attached to the station.

title: (23270) Gutar - Unnamed Road
description: Roadside picnic area, lots of parking suitable for all size of vehicle

title: (23009) Jaén - Carretera Bailén-Motril
description: Carrefour la loma car park, we spend the night quiet, highway close but worth it.

title: () La Guardia de Jaén - Unnamed Road
title_short: () La Guardia de Jaén - Unnamed Road
description: Recreational area with a great experience. Nice and quiet at sunset. Paved access but very steep road. Still accessible to Ac.

title: (23009) Jaén - N-323a
description: Parking in a shopping center area very close to the city of Jaén, you can spend the night very quietly, it served as a rest to continue on the road.

title: (23009) Jaén - Centro comercial jaen plaza
description: Good area to park and rest, since you are in a commercial area and the university is in front.

title: (23213) Santa Elena - N-IVa
description: Roadside rest stop - sort of flat. Suitable for an overnight stop but not setting up for a while. Quiet road but near main freeway so there is some traffic noise. You are well off the road. Has small bin and bench seat. Can easily fit more vehicles if parked well or travelling together and ok blocking each other in (4-6).  Near to national park. No street lights. There are a number of pull overs on the road that may also be suitable overnight stops.

title: (23191) Jaén - Carretera Bailén-Motril
description: CEPSA El Oasis service station. It has large parking for trucks and cars with 5 water intakes.

title: (23266) Montizón - C Real
description: Flat parking to rest on the way. Very calm....

title: (23311) Santo Tomé -
description: Good fallback spot in case of abundant world on the surrounding spots. Small corner by the river to cool off and relax. Access all vehicles.

title: () - A-319
description: Picnic area next to the chiringuito. Right next to the river, perfect for swimming, dining and a source of drinking water. Difficult access for large vehicles. During the day (we were in summer) it was crowded, but at night we were alone.

title: (23214) - 1 Poblado el Guindo
description: Esplanade in the mining town of Cherry (Caroline, Sierra Morena). Breathtaking views. As Starlight Destination included by UNESCO. A bit narrow for large motorhomes

title: (23213) Santa Elena - N-IVa
description: This is a ok place to stop and sleep, close to nature and a small road.

title: (23003) Jaén - Carretera Granada
description: Parking on the football pitch 2.5 km from the center. Avoid the match days.

title: (23213) Santa Elena - N-IVa
description: Viewpoint of the Organs. Parking next to the viewpoint, perfect for a break and eating with a view.

title: (23486) Hinojares - Unnamed Road
description: Bivouac for two or 3 × 4, calm just before the park of La Sierra Cazorla, which is prohibited at the bivouac, entry from 9h to 21h.

title: (23009) Jaén - 72 Calle Bedmar
description: Self-service laundry at Repsol gas station. They have an exclusive washing machine for pet clothes.

title: (23200) La Carolina - JA-6100
description: Thanks to 2 yellow posts (left side after the bridge) you can take a rough 100m road with the motorhome (quite unsuitable for large mobile homes) to the river. At the bottom there is a large flat lot (space for at least 3 campers). Cooling down in midsummer is wonderful. We only had one break, but you can certainly spend the night there without a problem.

title: (23009) Jaén - 36 Paseo de España
description: Very wide avenue where as a rule there are no problems to park. We stayed one night and great. Next to a large park and 30 minutes from downtown walking. On working days from 7 in the morning there is some traffic

title: (23009) Jaén - 9 Calle Principado de Asturias
description: Very large public parking, there is almost always a motorhome, it has no services but it is in the city

title: (23009) Jaén - 2 Calle Antonio Collado Almazan
description: Quiet place to park and spend the night, little traffic, little unevenness. There is a large boulevard 300 meters along which to walk, a bus stop that brings you to the center, a laundry 500 meters away.

title: (23003) Jaén - 44 Avenida Granada
description: Large parking lot of the city of Jaen feria, next to the local police. Without convenience but 1km from the cathedral, basilica and city center, beautiful views of the surroundings and apparently quiet. Very accessible even to the big truck or with trailer, we are there for Holy Week, a good compromise with the overbuilt parking close to the historic center. Can be closed during events or feria

title: (23009) Jaén - 3 Calle Doctor Eduardo García-Triviño López
title_short: (23009) Jaén - 3 Calle Doctor Eduardo García-Triviño López
description: Laundry.

title: (23215) Aldeaquemada - 37 Avenida de Andalucia
description: Parking next to the village square of the village quemada no service

title: (23003) Jaén - 30 Avenida Granada
description: Parking near the center of Jaen. It does not have its own services, but it is next to a petrol station with a supermarket and toilet

title: (23193) Arbuniel - 6 Avenida los Toscares
description: Wide and flat street in the center of town. Near the river source park.

title: (23006) Jaén - 9 Calle San Francisco Javier
description: Perfect and quiet to spend the night, the center is 15 minutes walk and the price is worth it because although it has no services it is guarded. It is ADIF parking.

title: (23486) Hinojares - A-6206
description: Under a big pine tree, shade assured just before the entrance of Sierra Cazorla which is closed From 9 pm to 9 am with ban of camping. 4x4 only steep access.

title: (23213) Santa Elena - N-IVa
description: Nice place to go hiking, visit cave of cave paintings and visit the Despeñaperros Natural Park. It has a source of drinking water and a garbage container. I recommend buying partridge pâté at the restaurant, which is very good apart from other things. Just say we leave this place better than we have found it.

title: (23213) - N-IVa
description: Off the main on a disused road. Access a little bumpy but OK for my Citroen Relay campervan, even tho i have low water-tanks underside.

title: (23193) Arbuniel - 2 Calle del Agua
description: Cool, nice and quiet place to have a picnic or rest. Space for 2-3 motorhomes

title: (23002) Jaén - 30-32 Calle Cerro de San Cristóbal
title_short: (23002) Jaén - 30-32 Calle Cerro de San Cristóbal
description: Quiet, parking area where you can spend the night, it is near the historic city of Jaen. We recommend visiting the cathedral.

title: (23006) Jaén - s/n Calle Fuente del Serbo
title_short: (23006) Jaén - s/n Calle Fuente del Serbo
description: Open parking, without a barrier, asphalt, flat, from a Lidl supermarket, easy access for large ACs. Opposite is a large playground and a Burger King. You can take a walk to the center and visit the city. There are no services.

title: (23486) Hinojares - 2B Carretera de Huesa
description: Slight asphalt slope Parque infaltil

title: (23005) Jaén - Calle Hospital de San Lazaro
title_short: (23005) Jaén - Calle Hospital de San Lazaro
description: Parking with some unevenness

title: (23004) Jaén - 30 Carretera al Parador
description: Very quiet place, hardly any traffic, shade and good views of Jaén, on the weekend I imagine from the remains of MC that I see, it must be more crowded

title: (23002) Jaén - 2 Calle Dean de la Fuente González
title_short: (23002) Jaén - 2 Calle Dean de la Fuente González
description: Slightly sloping parking, ample parking. Quiet at night, in summer more crowded. 20 minutes walk to the city center. Nice views.

address.street: 2 Calle Dean de la Fuente González

title: (13768) Almuradiel - Autovía del Sur
description: Quiet picnic area for a rest stop and eat, I don't think you can spend the night because it is a protected park. We have found the barbecues closed, of course because it is a fire season. When we were eating, the Civil Guard passed.

title: (23196) Puente de la Sierra -
description: High pressure drinking water fountain

title: (23214) El Centenillo - 4 Calle Pocicos
description: Parking in soccer field

title: (18520) El Hacho - Unnamed Road
description: Worth seeing at the old iron bridge station

title: (23486) Fontanar -
description: A large plateau with a magnificent view of the Rio Guadiana Menor. Very flat and not very stony.

title: (23214) Baños de la Encina - JM-5005
description: Beautiful place to spend a couple of days, in the middle of the ruins of the mining town, next to the master well of the place, 660 meters deep. We have done the MTB route from here going to La Carolina. Also hiking, visiting the different vestiges of this mining town. From this site you can see quite a few deer. Very quiet nights.

title: (23214) Baños de la Encina - JM-5005
description: Picnic area, drinking water, 4G 4 bars, quiet, first night impeccable, near El Centenillio, (old lead pencil and silver), site to see. further down the al aire meme, I have just seen a tap of drinking water next to barbecues and picnic tables, full of birds, especially the "Pie Bleue". Nice people. a nice place for relaxation, the landscapes leading to this place are very beautiful, beware the road is good but narrow.

title: (23196) Jaén - Unnamed Road
description: Recreational area of the cañada de hazadillas. With shadow. 100% natural environment. Equipped with barbecues and picnic areas. The hiking route to the chimba refuge starts from here. Narrow but tarred road.

title: (18561) Montejícar - Unnamed Road
description: Recently created car park, very quiet as it is on the outskirts of town and with views of the town and the area.

title: (18560) Guadahortuna - 20 Calle Albaicin
description: Right next to a cemetery. very peaceful, no traffic at all. no services, no signs that parking is not allowed. perfect for a night. N.B. the asphalted area is a helicopter landing spot so take care to park on the grass or (if you have a small vehicle) right up close to the wall.

title: (23130) Campillo de Arenas - Carretera Bailén-Motril
description: Rest area. Also truck stop. If you drive right to the entrance at the back, you can take a quiet and somewhat isolated break. The attached restaurant is busy.
